commits.message:
fix: Added proper updates/interactivity on the "Getting started" app integ‚Ä¶ (#17903)

* Added proper updates/interactivity on the "Getting started" app integrations.

- InstallAppButtonWithoutPlanCheck properly vends the mutation data in the render's props
- Fixed the improper props wiring in the AppConnectionItem
- Added a loading state for reactivity

* -Added toaster for error/success confirmation

build: Reduce bundle size from unnecessary bundeling react/jsx-runtime in embed-react package (#17790)

* Update vite.config.js

* linting fix

---------

Co-authored-by: Hariom <hariombalhara@gmail.com>

fix: bulk attribute assignment (#17896)

remove comment

issues.body:
## What does this PR do?

<!-- Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed. Please also include relevant motivation and context. List any dependencies that are required for this change. -->

It includes meeting link in the default reminder template for email and sms reminder workflows.

- Fixes #17922 (GitHub issue number)
- Fixes CAL-XXXX (Linear issue number - should be visible at the bottom of the GitHub issue description)

issues.title: feat: add meeting link in workflow reminder template

issues.body:
for team events:

broken og image URL: https://cal.com/_next/image?w=1200&q=100&url=%2Fapi%2Fsocial%2Fog%2Fimage?type=meeting&title=&meetingProfileName=

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/742b7747-e86a-42ca-93be-f3be6ee36f16)

for personal events:

og image for [i.cal.com/peer](http://i.cal.com/peer) since recently is broken too:

https://cal.com/_next/image?w=1200&q=100&url=%2Fapi%2Fsocial%2Fog%2Fimage?type=meeting&title=Meeting&meetingProfileName=Peer%20Richelsen&meetingImage=https%3A%2F%2Fcal.com%2Fapi%2Favatar%2Fc0e68239-b19e-4d30-b4f8-cf0b4b4cf457.png&names=Peer%20Richelsen&usernames=peer

see: 
https://www.opengraph.xyz/url/https%3A%2F%2Fi.cal.com%2Fpeer

<sub>[CAL-4823](https://linear.app/calcom/issue/CAL-4823/metadata-and-og-image-is-broken)</sub>
issues.title: [CAL-4823] metadata and og image is broken

issues.body:
Found a bug? Please fill out the sections below. üëç

### Issue Summary

Locally hosting my Calcom and I am having trouble logging back in after updating my stack in Portainer. I am trying to reset my password but I am not getting any email to reset my password.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Went to the login screen
2. Clicked on forgot
3. Typed in my email
4. No email for the password recover was received

Any other relevant information. For example, why do you consider this a bug and what did you expect to happen instead?

### Actual Results

- No email in inbox or spam folder to reset Calcom login

### Expected Results

- Receive an email that would allow me to reset my login password

### Technical details

Attached log - could be a hostname issue?
[_Calcom_logs.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17969653/_Calcom_logs.txt)

### Evidence

- Tested in my normal docker environment
issues.title: Unable to reset login password

pull_requests.body:
## What does this PR do?

- Fixes [#8501](https://github.com/calcom/cal.com/issues/8501)

Adds a script that extracts the port from the NEXT_PUBLIC_WEBAPP_URL in the .env file and then passes it as a PORT env variable to the next cli.

Loom Video: https://www.loom.com/share/b52f75d3f51e4bacab23d0bfa0dc660a?sid=f2489b89-90c0-4a8d-88ec-f97923817d4f

## Mandatory Tasks (DO NOT REMOVE)

- [ ] I have self-reviewed the code (A decent size PR without self-review might be rejected).
- [ ] I have updated the developer docs in /docs if this PR makes changes that would require a [documentation change](https://cal.com/docs). If N/A, write N/A here and check the checkbox.
- [ ] I confirm automated tests are in place that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works.

## How should this be tested?

- Update NEXT_PUBLIC_WEBAPP_URL and start the webapp to see it running on the new port
- If no port is specified it will default to 3000

<!-- Please describe the tests that you ran to verify your changes. Provide instructions so we can reproduce. Please also list any relevant details for your test configuration. Write details that help to start the tests -->

- Are there environment variables that should be set?
- What are the minimal test data to have?
- What is expected (happy path) to have (input and output)?
- Any other important info that could help to test that PR

## Checklist
